abstract: While investment banks are scrambling to get into the hedge fund business, officials say they need to know more about the industry.
snippet: While investment banks are scrambling to get into the hedge fund business, officials say they need to know more about the industry.
lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 13 — Lehman Brothers, the global investment bank, bought a 20 percent stake on Tuesday in the management companies of D. E. Shaw, a $29 billion hedge fund that is among the largest and oldest funds in the business.

headline.main: House Panel Ponders the Growth and Risk of Hedge Funds
headline.print_headline: As House Talks Hedge Funds, Lehman Buys Stake in One

abstract: In a strange coincidence, Lehman Brothers‘ announcement that it had bought a 20 percent stake in D. E. Shaw, a $29 billion hedge fund that is among the largest and oldest funds in the business, came the same day that the House Financial Services Committee held a hearing on hedge funds.
lead_paragraph: In a strange coincidence, Lehman Brothers‘ announcement that it had bought a 20 percent stake in D. E. Shaw, a $29 billion hedge fund that is among the largest and oldest funds in the business, came the same day that the House Financial Services Committee held a hearing on hedge funds.

headline.main: House Panel Ponders Risk of Hedge Funds

abstract: d Salzgitter, a German steel company, has dropped out of talks to buy a Canadian rival, Algoma Steel, after word of the secret negotiations leaked, driving up the price of a takeover and piquing the interest of other potential suitors. While Salzgitter has walked away four weeks after starting talks, there are other “interested parties” that surfaced after news of the Salzgitter discussions became public last month, Algoma said Tuesday, adding that it plans to enter into negotiations with them in hopes of salvaging a sale.
lead_paragraph: d Salzgitter, a German steel company, has dropped out of talks to buy a Canadian rival, Algoma Steel, after word of the secret negotiations leaked, driving up the price of a takeover and piquing the interest of other potential suitors. While Salzgitter has walked away four weeks after starting talks, there are other “interested parties” that surfaced after news of the Salzgitter discussions became public last month, Algoma said Tuesday, adding that it plans to enter into negotiations with them in hopes of salvaging a sale.

headline.main: Algoma Loses One Suitor, but Sees Others on the Horizon
